00044 struct clargs {
00045   Path command;                 
00046   EDEIoptions edeiopt;            
00047   EDEIprocess::Component contrast; 
00048   Path Mlistname;                               
00049   Path Plistname;                               
00050   string slicedesc;                             
00051   Path outmask;                             
00052   Filter filter_type;           
00053   Dcenter center;               
00054   unsigned nof_threads;         
00055   bool beverbose;                               
00056   bool SaveInt;                                 
00057 
00059   clargs(int argc, char *argv[]);
00060 };
00061 
00062 
00063 clargs::
00064 clargs(int argc, char *argv[]) :
00065   beverbose(false),
00066   nof_threads(0),
00067   SaveInt(false),
00068   outmask("reconstructed-<minus list>-@.tif"),
00069   contrast(EDEIprocess::REF)
00070 {
00071 
00072   poptmx::OptionTable table
00073         ("All-in-one EDEI-based CT reconstruction.",
00074          "Performs all procedures for the reconstruction:\n"
00075          "1) reads two text files describing the arrays of input files"
00076          " (foreground-background pairs) in minus and plus position of"
00077          " the analyzer crystal.\n"
00078          "2) removes the backgrounds in accordance with these files.\n"
00079          "3) performs the EDEI extraction of the requested contrast component.\n"
00080          "4) constructs the sinograms of the slices requested in the slice string.\n"
00081          "5) finally reconstructs the sinograms.\n"
00082          "All these procedures can be performed on the step-by-step basis using"
00083          " tools \"bg\", \"edei\", \"sino\" and \"ct\", but this approach saves all"
00084          " intermediate results on the hard disk and therefore a lot of time is"
00085          " spent for the I/O operations, memory allocations, etc. Also much more"       
00086  " disk space is used.");
00087 
00088   table
00089         .add(poptmx::NOTE,     "ARGUMENTS:")
00090         .add(poptmx::ARGUMENT, &Mlistname, "minus list",
00091                  "List of the input images in the minus position.", "")
00092         .add(poptmx::ARGUMENT, &Plistname, "plus list",
00093     "List of the input images in the plus position.", "")
00094         .add(poptmx::NOTE,     "",
00095                  "Arguments \"" + table.desc(&Mlistname) + "\""
00096                  " and \"" + table.desc(&Plistname) + "\". "
00097                  + AqSeries::Desc)
00098         .add(poptmx::ARGUMENT, &outmask, "result mask",
00099                  "Output result mask.", MaskDesc, outmask)
00100 
00101         .add(poptmx::NOTE,     "OPTIONS:")
00102         .add(poptmx::OPTION,   &contrast, 'C', "component",
00103                  "Type of the contrast component.",
00104                  "The component of the contrast to extract and reconstruct."
00105          " " + EDEIprocess::componentDesc, toString(contrast))
00106         .add(poptmx::OPTION,   &slicedesc, 's', "slice",
00107                  "Slices to be processed.", SliceOptionDesc, "<all>")
00108         .add(poptmx::OPTION,   &center, 'c', "center",
00109                  "Variable rotation center.", DcenterOptionDesc, toString(0.0))
00110         .add(poptmx::OPTION,   &filter_type, 'f', "filter",
00111                  "Filtering window used in the CT.", FilterOptionDesc, filter_type.name())
00112     .add(poptmx::OPTION, &edeiopt.RCname, 0, "rc",
00113          EDEIoptions::rcOptionShortDesc, EDEIoptions::rcOptionDesc)
00114         .add(poptmx::OPTION,   &nof_threads, 't', "threads",
00115                  "Number of threads used in calculations.",
00116                  "If the option is not used the optimal number is"
00117                  " calculated automatically.", "<all>")
00118         .add(poptmx::OPTION,   &SaveInt,'i', "int",
00119       "Output image(s) as integer.", IntOptionDesc)
00120     .add(edeiopt.options())
00121         .add_standard_options(&beverbose)
00122         .add(poptmx::MAN, "SEE ALSO:", SeeAlsoList);
00123 
00124   if ( ! table.parse(argc,argv) )
00125         exit(0);
00126   if ( ! table.count() ) {
00127         table.usage();
00128         exit(0);
00129   }
00130 
00131   command = table.name();
00132 
00133   // <minus list> and <plus list> : required arguments.
00134   if ( ! table.count(&Mlistname) )
00135     exit_on_error(command, string () +
00136                                   "Missing required argument: "+table.desc(&Mlistname)+".");
00137   if ( ! table.count(&Plistname) )
00138     exit_on_error(command, string() +
00139                                   "Missing required argument: "+table.desc(&Plistname)+".");
00140 
00141   // <result mask> : one more argument may or may not exist
00142   if ( ! table.count(&outmask) )
00143         outmask = upgrade(Mlistname.dtitle(), "reconstructed-") + "-@.tif";
00144   if ( string(outmask).find('@') == string::npos )
00145         outmask = outmask.dtitle() + "-@" + outmask.extension();
00146 
00147 }

00151 
00152 class slice_distributor {
00153 
00154 public:
00155 
00156   const Filter & filter;
00157   const Contrast & contrast;
00158   const Dcenter & center;                                       ///< Deviation of the rotation axis.
00159   const SinoS & sins;
00160   const vector<int> & slices;
00161   const string & sliceformat;
00162   const CTrec & rec;
00163 
00164   int SaveInt;
00165   int slice;                                    ///< Current projection index.
00166   int size;
00167   int pixels;
00168   bool verb;
00169   ProgressBar bar;
00170   pthread_mutex_t lock;         ///< Thread mutex used in the data distribution.
00171 
00172   slice_distributor(const SinoS & _sins, const vector<int> & _slices,
00173                                         const string & _sliceformat, const Dcenter & _center,
00174                                         const Filter & _filter, Contrast _contrast, int _SaveInt,
00175                                         bool _verb, const CTrec & _rec )
00176         : sins(_sins), slices(_slices), sliceformat(_sliceformat), center(_center),
00177           filter(_filter), contrast(_contrast), SaveInt(_SaveInt), verb(_verb), rec(_rec) {
00178 
00179         slice = 0;
00180         size = slices.size();
00181         pixels = sins.pixels();
00182     if ( pthread_mutex_init(&lock, NULL) != 0 )
00183       throw_error("slice_distributor", "Failed to initialize the mutex.");
00184         bar = ProgressBar(verb, "threaded reconstruction", size);
00185 
00186   }
00187 
00189   inline ~slice_distributor(){
00190     pthread_mutex_destroy(&lock);
00191   }
00192 
00201   inline bool distribute(int *_slice){
00202     pthread_mutex_lock(&lock);
00203         bool returned = slice < size;
00204         *_slice = slice++;
00205     pthread_mutex_unlock(&lock);
00206     return returned;
00207   }
00208 
00209 };
00210 
00211 
00212 void * in_thread (void * _args){
00213 
00214   slice_distributor * args = (slice_distributor *) _args;
00215   const CTrec & rec = args->rec;
00216 
00217   int slice;
00218   Map sinogram, result;
00219 
00220   while ( args->distribute(&slice) ) {
00221         args->sins.sino(slice, sinogram);
00222         rec.reconstruct(sinogram, result, args->center( args->slices[slice]+1 ) );
00223         SaveImage( fmt2s(args->sliceformat, args->slices[slice]+1), result, args->SaveInt);
00224         args->bar.update(slice);
00225   }
00226 
00227 }
00228 
00229 */
00230 
00232 int main(int argc, char *argv[]) {
00233 
00234   const clargs args(argc, argv);
00235   const AqSeries Mlist(args.Mlistname);
00236   const AqSeries Plist(args.Plistname);
00237   const EDEIprocess proc(args.edeiopt.RCname, args.edeiopt.Gm, args.edeiopt.Gp,
00238                          args.edeiopt.mpinter, args.edeiopt.smooth, args.edeiopt.acof);
00239   const EDEIexp expr(proc, args.contrast, Mlist, Plist);
00240   int
00241     thetas=expr.thetas(),
00242     pixels=expr.pixels(),
00243     slices=expr.slices();
00244   const string sliceformat = mask2format(args.outmask, slices);
00245   const vector<int> sliceV = slice_str2vec(args.slicedesc, slices);
00246   const SinoS sins(expr, sliceV, args.beverbose);
00247   CTrec rec(pixels, expr.contrast(), args.nof_threads, args.filter_type);
00248 
00249   /*
00250   if ( args.nof_threads == 1 || slices.size()<=2 ) {
00251   */
00252 
00253   ProgressBar bar(args.beverbose, "reconstruction", sliceV.size());
00254   for (unsigned slice=0 ; slice < sliceV.size() ; slice++ ) {
00255         Map sinogram(thetas, pixels), result(pixels, pixels);
00256         sins.sino(slice, sinogram);
00257         rec.reconstruct(sinogram, result, args.center(sliceV[slice]+1));
00258         SaveImage( toString(sliceformat, sliceV[slice]+1), result, args.SaveInt);
00259         bar.update();
00260   }
00261 
00262   /*
00263 
00264   } else {
00265 
00266         rec.threads(1);
00267         slice_distributor dist(sins, slices, sliceformat, args.center, args.filter_type,
00268                                                    Contrast::REF,args. SaveInt, args.beverbose, rec);
00269 
00270         int threads = nof_threads(args.nof_threads);
00271         pthread_t ntid [threads];
00272 
00273         for (int ith = 0 ; ith < threads ; ith++)
00274           if ( pthread_create(ntid+ith, NULL, in_thread, &dist ) )
00275                 throw_error("project sino in thread", "Can't create thread.");
00276 
00277         for (int ith = 0 ; ith < threads ; ith++)
00278           pthread_join( ntid[ith], 0);
00279 
00280   }
00281   */
00282 
00283   exit(0);
00284 
00285 }
